definition: internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally

sentences.english: The usual internal friction instrument is low-frequency mechanical relaxation instrument.
sentences.chinese: 通常的內耗儀，應爲低頻力學弛豫譜儀。

sentences.english: In previous studies on magnetoelastic internal frictions, the applied magnetic field was mostly static.
sentences.chinese: 過去作磁彈性內耗研究所用的磁場大都是靜磁場。

sentences.english: This in-fighting can be very detrimental to SOA.
Two internal friction peaks were found in pure rhombohedral PZT73 ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 在純三角相的PZT73陶瓷中發現兩個內耗峯。

definition: to take advantage of the new situation (idiom)/to make the best of new opportunities
top priority job/matter of vital importance
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
